text: having one today I'm sharing with you
some of my secrets to make the perfect
fried rice it's a very basic Asian dish
that everybody might have made at least
once in their life but you might still
be wondering why your homemade fried
rice isn't as good at the one at the
restaurant so let's see how you can make
it differently let's begin recipes you
want to soak want to chill Chinese
sausages in hot water to soften and then
dice them
[Music]
you also need some vegetables like
carrots corn a green piece you can dice
up the fresh ones and steam them or buy
the frozen package souljah vegetable
market you might want to use some
sausages or Vietnamese ham cut into
dices three cups up one day all cooked
rice I left in the fridge overnight add
a dash of water and you chopsticks you
flop the rice really well rule number
one you should always make fried rice
with one day all rice and not hot
steamed rice leaving the rice overnight
in the fridge we also have it to be
drier and also crispier when we fry in a
large bowl combine one cup of the frozen
vegetables half a cup of diet Vietnamese
ham or Cholewa have a cup of Chinese
sausages then season with a teaspoon of
chicken stock the 1/2 teaspoon salt and
half a teaspoon of sugar mix well
[Music]
eat a lot frying pan or nonstick wok and
add 2 tablespoon of vegetable then fry a
tablespoon of minced shallots and garlic
until fragrant and the veggies and
sausages and stir fry for about 3
minutes so those seasonings can absorb
into the vegetables then add the rice
and stir well for one to two minutes
make a hole in the middle of the rice
and crack in one egg near the spatula to
beat up the egg and sprinkle some pepper
into it when the egg is roughly solid
device you can mix in the rice and stir
everything up again this is the second
tip to keep the rice grain still dry and
not overcooking the egg if you crack the
egg directly onto the rice the rice is
gonna get kind of wet and soggy if you
fry the eggs before adding the rice
there's going to be overcook and turn to
dry so the trick of making the hole in
the center of the rice really great
you can press out the rice and cook for
a few minutes so the rice at the bottom
turn more golden and crispy transfer to
a serving plate
[Music]
you
sprinkle some pepper on top and some
cilantro or mint to garnish serve with a
bowl of chili soy sauce another trick to
make a perfect fried rice is that you
don't want to overcrowd the rice and the
vegetable in the pan and the rush one
they use a very large wok and fry maybe
just one or two portion at a time that's
how they get the rice grains really dry
and separate
I hope these tricks help you to perfect
your fried rice dish and if you make it
next time don't forget to send me a
photo of your fried rice on instagram
facebook or twitter with the hashtag
helen recipes so I can see how great it
turns out thank you so much for watching
bye bye
